I remember being there and I had never seen so many people in my life 

The audience was huge and packed front to back and there were people who were still trying to get in!

And it was my first time I had smelled so much pot like every where lol 

And then I was allowed to see queen from backstage or really more like the side and I don't know from what perspective the energy was more intense 

Be it from the audience or from the stage it's self it was none the less very exciting

But everyone in the audience and even in the hallways of the stadium kept commenting on not only how loud it was but that it was the best sound quality they ever experienced compared to other concerts.

I believe aside from the bands who played there and their own great performances that it was the sound quality that made the concert one of the most  memorable shows ever and surely one of the best experiences to ever have.

A comment was made that Live Aid was more than "just Queen".  When it came to performance sets as far as music, YES, Queen took the #1 spot. The viewers watched this epic 16 hour show to donate and enjoy the music. Queen took it extremely serious and did exactly what they were supposed to do, and absolutely nailed it. They were brilliant & they rehearsed it; a lot! Most important; they were there for the CAUSE; not to promote. So, yeah, there is quite a bit to hype about over them.  If anyone is interested in the behind scenes on why they excelled, watch the video from Wings of Pegasus (awesome guy) on 'why Queen were so good at Live Aid'.  Fil explains it in detail, and the appreciation for what Queen did simply puts a deep appreciation for it. Other than that, keep enjoying this decades later to all of the bands that performed. âœŒğŸ’–
